meanings.definition: To spend the summer in a dormant state, as certain animals.
meanings.sent1: During the hot months, the turtles estivated in the cool shade.
meanings.sent2: The frogs estivated by burrowing deep into the mud to escape the heat.
meanings.sent3: The lazy bear decided to estivate all summer, missing out on all the fun.
meanings.sent4: The old cat estivated like a hibernating bear, hardly moving for weeks.
meanings.sent5: The idea of estivating like a lizard in the sun sounded relaxing to the tired squirrel.

meanings.definition: To pass the summer in a state of torpor.
meanings.sent1: The snakes estivated in the sun-warmed rocks, barely moving for days.
meanings.sent2: The tortoise estivated under the bush, conserving energy during the hot season.
meanings.sent3: The dog pretended to estivate, lying still in the shade to avoid playing fetch.
meanings.sent4: The town estivated in the summer heat, with streets deserted during the day.
meanings.sent5: The idea of estivating like a sloth seemed appealing to the tired rabbit.
